response.answer_text: I think it is accepted by most people that there was an emperor of France named Napoleon Bonaparte during the start of the 19th century. There are signs of his reign all over Europe. He destroyed the Holy Roman Empire and allowed a Prussian state to exists, he made Russia the super power it is today, and he promoted the glory of France making it a European superpower. In conclusion, there was a man named Napoleon Bonaparte who did many things in Europe, but if all that he did was great is a different story.

There are more memoirs about Napoleon than perhaps anyone else including Jesus (who some like to say never existed). It is said Napoleon is the second most written about person ever (after Jesus). They say Shakespeare is the third and people also like to say that Shakespeare never existed. We’re listening to these Napoleon Memoirs every day to get to know this fascinating man better: Napoleon Memoirs links — The Tanster

Very, very real. Most countries have some record of him (some more than others) with events and dates of his exploits. We have photographs of his nephew emperor Napoleon III, as well as veterans of the Napoleonic Wars. He has living family who hold a claim to the French Empireal throne.
Of course he did. Born in 1769 in Corsica island (now a Région of France), died in 1821 in St Helena island in the South Atlantic, while in exile.
